data: Diabetes in Pregnancy Postpartum (Module)
Admit/Transfer/Discharge
This order set applies only to patients with gestational diabetes and not patients with pre-existing Type 1 or Type 2 diabetes
Patient Care
POC Glucose Whole Blood
TID before food, discontinue after 2 readings below 7 mmol/L
QID before food and bedtime, discontinue after 2 readings below 7 mmol/L
q6h, while NPO
Continuous Infusions
sodium chloride 0.9% (NS) continuous infusion
order rate: 20 mL/h, IV, drug form: bag
order rate: 50 mL/h, IV, drug form: bag
order rate: 75 mL/h, IV, drug form: bag
order rate: 100 mL/h, IV, drug form: bag
Medications
insulin regular - correction scale
Sliding scale, subcutaneous, TID before food, drug form: inj
Sliding scale, subcutaneous, QID before food and bedtime, drug form: inj
Sliding scale, subcutaneous, q6h, drug form: inj
insulin lispro - correction scale
Sliding scale, subcutaneous, TID with food, drug form: inj
Sliding scale, subcutaneous, QID with food and bedtime snack, drug form: inj
Sliding scale, subcutaneous, q6h, drug form: inj
Consults/Referrals
For patients who require more than 20 units of insulin in 24 hours on sliding scale or if glucometer readings before breakfast are consistently above 6 mmol/L, consult Endocrinology
Dietitian Adult Consult
Reason for Consult: Other (see special instructions), diabetes in pregnancy
Diabetes Educator Consult
Reason for Consult: diabetes in pregnancy
